content: OCBC 365 Card OCBC 360 DBS Multiplier Investments Credit Card Savings Asked by AnonymousAsked on 05 Apr 2019Should I switch to DBS Multiplier? Currently have around $6K in OCBC360, salary credited hit $2K, credit card spending $500 knowing that OCBC365 have to spend $800 at least & invested ETF $500/monthly?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 06 Apr 2019Assuming you do not have any loans/investment/insurance with DBS/POSB and did not insure/invest with OCBC, the interest rate is the same at 1.80%. You can try using the interest rate calculator for both accounts online to see which gives a better deal.0 comments1
